translation: Can fire that burns by touch burn like Parting of the hearts love-sick?
explanation: Fire burns when touched; but, like the sickness of love, can it also burn when removed ?
mk: ஒருவரையொருவர் காணாமலும் தொடாமலும் பிரிந்திருக்கும் போது காதல் நோய் உடலையும் உள்ளத்தையும் சுடுவது போன்ற நிலை நெருப்புக்கு இல்லை; நெருப்பு தொட்டால் சுடும்; இது, பிரிவில் சுடுகிறதே!
mv: நெருப்பு, தன்னைத் தொட்டால் சுடுமே அல்லாமல் காமநோய் போல் தன்னை விட்டு நீங்கிய பொழுது சுடவல்லதாகுமோ.
sp: தீ தன்னைத் தொட்டவரைத்தான் சுடும்; காதல் நோயைப் போல அதை விட்டு அகன்றாலும் சுடுமோ?
gptExplanation:
This verse from Thiru Kural highlights the intense nature of love and its profound impact, comparing it to the burn of fire. When you touch fire, it burns, but once you remove your touch, the burning sensation eases. However, love, likened here to a sickness, is not the same. The pain and longing associated with love can persist even in the absence of the loved one, much like a lingering illness. This is a unique aspect of love that differentiates it from physical sensations like the touch of fire.

The verse points out the deep emotional attachment and the inevitable pain in love, especially when separated from the loved one. It emphasizes the all-consuming nature of love that goes beyond physical presence and continues to affect the person even when the loved one is not physically present. Thus, the poet beautifully captures the persistent and pervasive nature of love, which is more enduring and impactful than the pain caused by a momentary touch of fire.

This verse is a reflection on the human experience of love and its profound impact on the psyche. The comparison to fire and illness underscores the intensity and the enduring nature of these feelings, offering a deep understanding of the emotional complexities involved in love and longing.
